text.76: Finally, Allah consoled the Prophet Muhammad, peace and blessings be upon him, from the behavior and actions of the disbelieving and polytheistic people. That is, the Prophet did not need to feel sad listening to their nonsensical words and accusations directed at him and the Qur'an. Allah is All-Knowing of all their deeds, both those done openly and those they conceal. All of that will be accounted for to them on the Day of Judgment, and they will surely receive their recompense in the form of a painful punishment.
text.77:
Because some people do not believe in the Day of Resurrection, in this verse Allah reminds them of His power in creating humans, as part of all His creation. This is stated with a tone of astonishment at the attitude of some people. Namely: do humans not think and pay attention to the fact that Allah created them from a drop of semen, but then after going through a process, they are born into the world in the form of perfect humans, and then they become people who are hostile to Allah and His Messenger. This kind of attitude is truly unacceptable to a healthy mind.

If humans realize that Allah is able to create them, even from a drop of semen, and then make them the best creatures on this earth, surely they will be convinced that Allah is also able to return them to their original state, and He is also able to repeat His creation, that is, to resurrect them as they were in their original life. Therefore, humans should not be hostile to Allah's commands.
text.78: This verse explains the doubts of the disbelievers of Mecca regarding the existence of the Day of Resurrection. They held this opinion because they had forgotten the origin of their own creation. They are reminded that Allah created them from a drop of semen, so that they were born as living and complete human beings. If they remembered and realized this, they would surely be convinced that Allah is also able to bring them back to life after death, even if their bones have been crushed.
text.79:
In this verse, Allah commands Prophet Muhammad (saw) to answer the questions of those people mentioned above, by affirming that the One who will revive those decayed bones back into living and complete human beings is Allah, who created them in the first instance, from non-existence into existence. Allah is All-Knowing of all His creations.

For humans, repeating an action is easier than doing it for the first time. However, for Allah, creating something for the first time is just as easy as repeating it, because Allah is All-Powerful.
text.80:
In this verse, it is mentioned that Allah also commands His Messenger to explain to those polytheists that the One who will revive those decayed bones is Allah, who created for them a blazing fire from wood that was originally a moist and green tree, but then the wood became dry so that it could ignite a fire. In daily life, the Arabs already knew that there were several types of wood that, when rubbed together, would spark a fire. All of this was created by Allah for humans so that they could warm themselves, cook, use it for lighting, and various other needs.

Giving this example is quite clear to those who use firewood daily. They think that the decayed bones have become cold and dry and can no longer receive life, because life requires heat. Yet, every day they witness that wood that is decayed and cold can generate heat and ignite fire. Even wood that is still wet and leafy can also ignite fire.

According to scientific studies, fire here can be interpreted as energy. In plants, there is indeed a process of utilizing solar energy to convert materials taken by the plant into chemical energy. The explanation of how this energy transformation occurs, which is called photosynthesis, is as follows.

Of the many parts of a plant, one of the most important is the presence of chloroplasts, which are found in the leaves. In these chloroplasts, there are thousands of chlorophyll granules, known in the language of the Qur'an as *al-khadir* (green material). The two verses above mention the existence of chlorophyll, which is green (al-An'am/6: 99), and the role of the sun in running this "green factory" (at-Takwir/81: 17-18).

Plant cells, unlike human or animal cells, can directly use solar energy. Plants will convert solar energy into chemical energy and store it in the form of nutrients in a special way. This process is called photosynthesis. These green cells can only be seen with a microscope. This is the only laboratory in the world that can store solar energy in the form of organic matter.

As described above, plants are the most important creatures for the survival of other creatures. In addition to producing food, the photosynthesis process carried out by plants also produces oxygen. Oxygen is the material for breathing for all living things, including humans and animals.

Thus, it is fitting that Allah gives the example that not only dry wood can ignite fire, but even green and wet wood can also be used as firewood. Conversely, bones that can receive life are not only fresh bones, but even decayed bones can also receive life by the power of Allah.
text.81: Allah poses a question to those who do not believe in the Day of Resurrection: if they believe that Allah is capable of creating the heavens and the earth, why is Allah not also capable of creating something similar to that? The answer is that Allah is certainly capable of creating it, because He is the All-Creator, the All-Knowing.
text.82:
Allah explains how easy it is for Him to create something. When He wills to create a creature, it is sufficient for Allah to say, "Be," and immediately that creature comes into existence.

Considering His immense power, the existence of the Day of Resurrection, where humans are brought back to life after the destruction on the Day of Judgment, is not impossible and should not be denied.
text.83:
Those who believe will surely say that Allah is Most Holy. In His hand is the full power over everything in this universe. He is the One who creates, regulates, and maintains it. To Him all creatures will be returned.

This kind of acknowledgement and belief will certainly arise when a person uses sound reasoning to observe the contents of this entire universe, which serves as evidence for the power of Allah.
